repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: An incomplete copy of the Tiruvātavūrār Purāṇam (text and commentary), a poem on the life of Māṇikkavācakar, by Kaṭavuṇmāmuṉivar (15th century?). See Sweetman & Ilakkuvan (2012, p. 66), Zvelebil (1995, p. 334, 405).
The manuscript stops short at the beginning of the final chapter (Tiruvaṭi peṟṟac carukkam), at the beginning of stanza 8.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (October 2021).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

collation.desc: 2 folios = guard leaves. No foliation. Blank recto verso. Truncated. 385 x 30 mm.

201 folios = Tiruvātavūrār Purāṇam: Text & Commentary. Tamil foliation [11], then Tamil foliation 12-28, 30-32, 41-73, 75-91, 93-1011, 1012-108, 110-114, 119-122, 126-193, 197, 199-216, 230-234, [235]. Some foliations corrected. f175-f176: left margin (with foliation) truncated. f232-f234: left margin damaged; foliation thus illegible. 385 x 35 mm.

supportDesc.condition: Relatively good state of preservation. But old and somehow fragile. Some sticky folios. More damaged at the end. A fragment (left side of U2, f235) is kept in an envelop.

additions.desc: BnF shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 81 (front cover, recto).

Note in black ink on a sticker pasted on the (front cover, recto), presumably by Burnouf: Ancien manuscrit tamoul qui me parait être la traduction de quelque Purâṇa sanscrit. D'une main ancienne mais lisible. The same description is found in Burnouf's library catalogue (S.n. 1854, p. 346, no. 172).

binding.p: Original wood covers. Shelfmark and note (front cover, recto). 385 x 35 mm.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Dated to circa 1770 by Vinson (1868) and to 1770 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds (presumably palaeographical and material analysis arguments). Not after 1852, since part of the collection of Eugène Burnouf (1801-1852).

provenance.p: Owned by Eugène Burnouf (1801-1852). — See S.n. 1854, p. 346, no. 172.

acquisition.p: Acquired, August 2nd, 1854, from “Madame veuve Burnouf”. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 2 = Acquisitions: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1893, no. 4955.

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 16, no. 81.
Sweetman, Will & R. Ilakkuvan. 2012. The Bibliotheca Malabarica: Bartholomäus Ziegenbalg’s Tamil Library: An Annotated edition and translation. Pondicherry: EFEO and IFP. (Indologie no. 119).
S.n. 1854. Catalogue des livres imprimés et manuscrits composant la bibliothèque de feu M. Eugène Burnouf. Paris: Duprat. — See p. 346, no. 172.

Vinson, Julien. 1868. Manuscrits tamouls. Proofreadings of the catalogue for Tamoul 1-204 (old shelfmark). Printed by the atelier oriental de l’Imprimerie nationale. BnF “4-IMPROR-77 (B)”. — The same proofreadings with black ink handwritten corrections are found in Vinson et al. (1866-, f1-f49). — See p. 23, no. 81.
Zvelebil, Kamil V. 1995. Lexicon of Tamil Literature. Leiden [etc.]: Brill.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.

revisionDesc.change: Revised by Emmanuel FRANCIS. Version 1, May 2022.
